string.val: Thank you for selecting this Hosting Plan. Please register your customer account. If you are already registered as our customer, enter your existing account requisites to let us set up your subscription. Your account information will be used only as contact information for support and service. Your account profile includes your personal login and password used to access a web-based Control Panel. Control Panel allows you to manage your subscription(s) and use services you subscribed for. You can change any personal information entered for your account from the Control Panel.

Business Accounts are perfect for corporate customers. Service terms are similar for business and personal accounts. However, business accounts allow specifying more e-mail contacts to share different aspects of subscription management.

Personal Accounts are designed for personal customers. If you are planning to manage your subscription and use services for your own needs, this account type meets your needs. Personal accounts allow specifying a single e-mail contact for all issues.

Welcome to the Parallels Business Automation - Standard ® Initial Setup Wizard!
Parallels Business Automation - Standard ® offers many features that contribute to successful and profitable hosting business. However, there are some basic and integrated settings that form the working background for the Parallels Business Automation - Standard Provider Control Center.
Following this step-by-step setup, you can configure the initial settings. Any of them can be changed in the normal course of work, after you quit this wizard. The main goal of the wizard is to introduce you to the Parallels Business Automation - Standard infrastructure and at the same time to help you start configuring the Provider Control Center correctly right now.
Please click the Next button to continue.

Please read the User Agreement (scroll down the screen). If you are ready to accept it, check the box below the Agreement text. Please note that you cannot continue the setup without accepting the terms of the User Agreement.

string.c: Initial Setup | Person and Account | Default Administrator
string.val: The attributes of your Provider Account administrative user. Generally, a user is a record in the database containing the name of the person authorized to log into the Provider Control Center on behalf of your Provider Account using the given login/password, and some user-specific regional settings. Later you can register more users within your Provider Account.

string.c: Initial Setup | Person and Account | PBAs Company Profile
string.val: The name and address of your hosting company. Please fill in all the fields carefully; it is necessary for a successful domain registration, since the information from an Account profile is normally transferred to an Internet Registrar during a domain registration.

string.c: Initial Setup | Person and Account | PBAs Company Administrative Contact
string.val:
This is the name and contacts of a person responsible for administrative issues in your PBAs company. This is not a new user, but just an additional information attached to your Account.
The name and e-mail address are used by Parallels Business Automation - Standard to send automatically generated e-mails related to administrative issues. Note that later you can set the billing and technical contacts for your Provider Account.

string.c: Initial Setup | Person and Account | Default Regional Settings
string.val: The regional settings are applied by default not only to Provider Account users, but to all users registered in Parallels Business Automation - Standard. These settings are applied to the registration form fields and can be changed during registration or later.
The currency settings are applied by default to all documents. You need to define the exchange rate of the PBAs currency

string.c: Initial Setup | Person and Account | Currency Settings
string.val: The currency settings are applied by default to all documents.

string.c: Initial Setup | Person and Account | Parallels Business Automation - Standard Messenger
string.val: Parallels Business Automation - Standard ® provides an option to automatically generate and send e-mail notifications to Provider Administrator (for example, notifications on the current Account balance) or to PBAs customers (for example, if the subscription period is about to expire). Each e-mail message has the "From" field containing the name (it can be the name of your PBAs company) and sender e-mail (we recommend to enter a valid address as the user replies are directed to this address).

string.c: Initial Setup | License | Current Parallels Business Automation - Standard License
string.val: This form shows you whether the Parallels Business Automation - Standard License is installed now and, if installed, the current capacity of the License.

This form allows you to install the Parallels Business Automation - Standard License Certificate. Paste the license text into the corresponding field or click the Browse button to locate the License file.

string.c: Initial Setup | Data Center | Domain Registration
string.val: Please check the boxes next to the top-level domain names to enable them for the Dummy domain plug-in. Later you can configure other plug-ins, however Dummy alone is enough for the default domain registration testing purposes.

string.c: Initial Setup | Data Center | Register Default Domain
string.val: The default domain is offered to your customers in store for the subdomain creation. Later you can set more default domains (this can be done easily, by editing the domain properties).

string.c: Initial Setup | Data Center | IP Pool for VPS Container
string.val:
The IP addresses assets assigned to the Parallels Business Automation - Standard cluster are managed by groups (IP pools). IP pools are assigned to the particular types of hosting available in Parallels Business Automation - Standard. Assigning an IP pool to a specific type of hosting means that IP addresses from this IP pool will be used for provisioning of particular type of services.
Please enter the parameters of the IP pool to be used for the provisioning of Containers.

string.c: Initial Setup | Data Center | IP Pool for name-based VPS Container
string.val: Please enter the parameters of the IP pool to be used for the provisioning of name-based Containers.

string.c: Initial Setup | Data Center | IP Pool for webhost Domain Hosting
string.val: Please enter the parameters of the IP pool assigned to webhost Domains.

string.c: Initial Setup | Billing | Default Credit Term
string.val:
The credit terms define the order of settlements with your customers.
Credit terms are applied per account. The default credit terms are applied to all accounts your customers create in your store. Customers cannot view the default credit terms. The default credit terms setting is important, though you can create more credit terms and reassign the settings later.
Title is a short name for Credit Terms, for reference only.
Order validity period is the maximum period of time an open Order can stay in the open state. After validity date an Order is cancelled automatically.
Due period is the period of time during which Invoices should be paid.
Overdue period is the period that starts after Invoice due period runs out. An Invoice is considered as overdue and penalty (overdue charge) is imposed. In this case an additional Overdue Invoice is being issued, however, the charged services are provided during the overdue period.
Charge rate is penalty value (part of Invoice sum)and is applied on a yearly basis. For example, if the charge rate is set to 365%, then daily charge equals to 1% of Invoice total sum per day.
Minimal charge is the minimal penalty sum, regardless of the actual penalty, the sum is calculated in accordance with the charge rate.

string.c: Initial Setup | Billing | Subscription Expiration Terms
string.val:
Part of the credit terms settings. In this case it is a part of the default credit terms.
The subscription expiration terms define what happens to a subscription close to its expiration date and after the expiration date is past.
Please select the subscription life-cycle related settings for each subscription period available:
Grace period - the period that starts after the subscription period expires. The grace period is an additional opportunity for a debtor to renew the subscription. During the grace period, a Provider already has the right to suspend his services. After the grace period runs out, a Provider terminates the subscription. The minimal default grace period is one day.
Termination Period - the period of time after the subscription expiration date when a subscription is terminated without respect to any other conditions.
Renewal order period - the period of time before a subscription expiration date when a renewal order is generated. The minimal default renewal order period is one day.
Please remember that an Order validity period should exceed the Renewal Order Period. Otherwise, a Renewal Order can be cancelled automatically before subscription expiration date.

Here you can enable taxation for your store and set two tax rates. To enable taxation, check the Enable Taxation box.
Tax rates are applied automatically to orders lump sums depending on the customer tax zone.
The initial setup automatically creates the default tax zone which is applied to all accounts. In this case, the default tax zone groups the tax rates that you define. The order of tax rates application is similar to the order of rates in the form. The default rates application period is one year starting from the current date.
Later you can create more tax zones and tax rates and assign them in a stricter way. In addition, later you can use the Tax Exemption Code.

string.c: Initial Setup | Billing | Credit Card Processing
string.val: To use the recurrent billing and process the delayed transactions, the credit card data should be saved in Parallels Business Automation - Standard database. Check the relevant box to save the credit card data once entered in Parallels Business Automation - Standard.

The types of services you are going to provide (Container, webhost domain, miscellaneous, etc.).
Here you can select hosting plan types to be created in your Provider Control Center. To select, check the box next to the plan type name. In addition you can key in new names for hosting plan types selected. These names will be shown in the beginning of the hosting plan creation wizard. You can change the plan type names later.

string.c: Initial Setup | Store and Site | Site Logo
string.val: Please upload the logotype to be shown on every page of your website. You can use HTML text instead. Select an option and either upload an image or paste the HTML text into the relevant field.

string.c: Initial Setup | Store and Site | Interface Setup
string.val: Please select a skin (a set of images and a palette) to be applied to the Parallels Business Automation - Standard tools by default. Later you can change the default skin in the Interface Settings of your Provider Control Center.

string.c: Initial Setup | Store and Site | Store Setup
string.val: Here you can open your online store to make it available on the Web. Check the box to open the store.

string.c: Initial Setup | Trouble Ticketing | Trouble Ticketing Setup
string.val:
Here you can enable the Trouble Ticket System that allows receiving and managing problem reports (trouble tickets) from customers.
You can mark the Enabled for customers check box to make the Trouble Ticket System available for customers (in this case your customers can view the Trouble Ticket System link in the Help & Support zone of the Control Panel).
You can mark the Allow posting new tickets check box to allow your customers to submit problem reports using the Trouble Ticket System.

string.c: Initial Setup | Trouble Ticketing | Tickets Queues
string.val: Create at least one Queue to place a problem report (e.g., new, on hold, etc.). Later you can move tickets from one queue to another.

string.c: Initial Setup | Trouble Ticketing | Tickets Priorities
string.val: Priority of problem (e.g., normal, high, etc.). Note that when you enable the Trouble Ticket System, you need to create at least one priority that will be assigned to all the new tickets posted by customers. Later you can view the ticket details and assign another priority to a ticket.

string.c: Initial Setup | Trouble Ticketing | Tickets Categories
string.val: Create one or more ticket categories (roughly pre-defined problem subjects). Customers will select a category when placing a problem report from the Control Panel.

Thank You.
The initial setup is finished. All the initial settings made by you are saved.
This short post-installation configuration of Parallels Business Automation - Standard ® allows you to connect to the servers in your Data Center, create hosting plans and open an online store. At any moment you can change the initial settings. Please use the context help and other documentation available in the %cc_name% via the Help link and at the Support - Documentation page.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard ® provides a number of features that are not covered by the setup wizard. You can configure more payment and domain registration plug-ins, use the advanced e-commerce store features, publish the online partner application form, manage online marketing campaigns and affiliate programmes, and more.
Welcome to Parallels Business Automation - Standard!
Please click the "Finish" button to continue. You will be taken to your Control Center interface.

To transfer your domain name to our servers, you just need to fill in a Domain Name Record Modification Form at the registrar where your domain name was registered. Every domain should be subscribed to at least two name servers in order to work. The part of your domain name record that needs to be changed is the "Name Server Information" section. Parallels Business Automation - Standard Integration Guide

The document is intended for the hosting service provider administrators. It covers Parallels Business Automation - Standard customization and integration ability. Perl programming skills are required.

The document is intended for the hosting service provider administrators. Provides guidelines for the application templates creation.

More secure. Please remember that selecting this option will wipe out secure keys/passphrases stored in the system. In the human-supervised mode a secure key/passphrase pair is stored in the database only temporarily, no less than a minute after it is entered, so it is possible to decrypt a payment method private data some time after you have entered the key/password without the need to re-enter the pair each time you need it. string.val: Parallels Business Automation - Standard Control Center (PBAs CC) is a GUI client application. It provides full management and control over Hardware Nodes and Containers.
The current version of the product was tested on Windows2000, NT4.0 and on beta version of Windows Whistler. At this moment program won't run on Windows9x or Windows ME operating systems.
In the Namespace tree open the context menu for Parallels Business Automation - Standard IDC Location and select New IDC Location menu item.
In the property sheet you need to enter IP addresses for the Management Node and configuration database as well as valid login credentials.
NOTE: your public SSH identity file must be registered on the Management Node.

Parallels Business Automation - Standard Reseller Guide
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Enterprise Customer Guide
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Installation Guide
The document is intended for hosting service provider administrators. It covers the installation and initial setup of Parallels Business Automation - Standard ®.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Provider Guide
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Installation Guide
The document is intended for hosting service provider administrators. It covers the installation and initial setup of Parallels Business Automation - Standard ®.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Provider's Guide

The document is intended for hosting service providers. It shortly describes the most important tasks a provider can perform using the Parallels Business Automation - Standard Provider Control Center. For more details, please refer to the HTML manual available by clicking on the Help link at the top of every Parallels Business Automation - Standard screen.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Reseller's Guide
The document is intended for PBAs resellers. It describes the most important tasks and Reseller's working scenarios in the Reseller Control Center.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Enterprise Customer's Guide
The document is intended for the enterprise customers that use Parallels Business Automation - Standard Enterprise Customer Control Center.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Subscriber's Guide

The document is intended for the customers who have purchased hosting services in Provider's or Reseller's Parallels Business Automation - Standard-based online stores and describes the tasks (excluding webhost domains management) a customer can perform in Parallels Business Automation - Standard Control Panel. webhost domain administration is described in a separate guide.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard User's Guide
The document is intended for subscriber's end-users and describes the tasks one can perform using Parallels Business Automation - Standard My Control Panel.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Trouble Ticket System Guide
The document is intended for subscribers and instructs a customer to post and manage trouble reports.
The webhost original manual is intended for customers who have purchased the webhost Hosting Plans in the Parallels Business Automation - Standard online store.
What's new in Parallels Business Automation - Standard ®
Short overview of new features added to Parallels Business Automation - Standard ®.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Advanced Configuration Manual
This guide describes the advanced tasks related to Parallels Business Automation - Standard administering.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Translation Guide

Parallels Business Automation - Standard Translation guide. The document provides guidelines on Parallels Business Automation - Standard interface translation by adding a new language pack. The guide is intended for the hosting service provider administrators.
Parallels Business Automation - Standard Templates Creation Guide
The document is intended for the hosting service provider administrators. Provides guidelines on the creation of application templates.
The document describes the most important and frequently-used Parallels Business Automation - Standard working scenarios.
To get more guides, please visit PBAS Documentation page.

The table below shows all the data that can be restored from the backup.
The column to the left includes the names of the objects that can be migrated from the backup.
The column to the right shows the current status of each object:
'Exists' - the existing object matches the corresponding data contained in the backup and will not be overwitten with the backup data.
'Conflict' - the existing object differs from the corresponding data contained in the backup and will be overwitten with the backup data.
If an object already exists in the Container and does not conflict with the backup data, it will not be restored and will stay unchanged.
If some objects conflict with the data in Container, they will be updated from the backup.

Automatically register Parallels VPS Containers OS/application templates

This option controls automatic registration of Parallels VPS Containers OS/application templates when you get them from Hardware Node. If enabled, all the templates from Hardware Node will be registered in Parallels Business Automation - Standard. If disabled, only the synchronization state of existing templates will be updated. You can start getting templates from the Hardware Node any time on the corresponding Hardware Node configuration screens.
